message:
Do I have to study computer science/have a computer science degree to make it as a developer? Or can I be a self-educated one through online resources?
What's your experience with/opinion on that?

data.message:
el degree dih 3shan masr :D
you can be self-educated one and it'll be cool :D
عشان مصر؟ O.o

عشان الشهادة هنا حاجة مهمة جداً خصوصا لما تيجى تتجوز :'(
عامة يعنى لو عرفت تظبط نفسك اونلاين و بقيت جامد محدش هيسأل إنت اتعلمت ازاى مدام إنت برنس :D
إنت فاكرهم بيعلمونا حاجة فى الجامعة؟ :D
Self educated is sometimes better than college educated. Just ask my homie Ahmad Alfy
exactly :D
Well, thanks for the reassurance, it's just hard and bit intimidating that you start to lose sight and question sometimes :/
كلنا هذا الرجل
If certificates are important, you can go for private certification in any field relevant to your career work, for example CCNA, Microsoft certification, MBA, etc
I was saying if it provides background or are helpful in terms of data and science but since you said self education can even be better than school, then doesn't matter, I guess
Certificates are required by most employers, unfortunately.

Amr Tag howa kol wa7da wo leeha myza bs fe sho3;l nfso : msh htfr2 i have a friend who works for Microsoft & he graduated in electrical engineering ( kahrba power ):D
bs as self-educated you have to know what to study 3shan donnya mtb2ash 3ayma mnk 2wy wo mtrkzsh 3le just  programming languages rkz 3le techniques wo design patterns wo kda y3ne
Well, I'm trying to learn front end web development and Ruby on Rails so if you guys came across any resources on these, feel free to pass my way, I'd appreciate it :)

Okay :D it's so wide field @ For RoR there are a course of two parts on edx (I missed part 1 because my damn study )
https://courses.edx.org/courses/BerkeleyX/CS_CS169.1x/1T2014/info
You're my hero!!
I"m working as a front-end developer and I have a commerce degree and I'm on my way to learn CS. It's all about you and everything you can learn online. It's just a matter of passion
Start with one thing front end or Ror, because every one is so huge and totally different and you will work with just one
Well, I know html, css and enough javascript to manipulate plugins and code snippets to create a website

Amr Tag what's meant by front end development is very huge & more than what u have said :D 
For example how to display the same site on different devices of different sizes
Oh, well, that's what I'm trying to get to :/
Shady Atef I totally agree, it becomes so huge
Just give it the time to learn and doing some side projects and you will be amazed of what you can do
But it can be done if I am passionate about them both, correct?

What you want me to call you? A rails developer or a front end developer, mainly focus on one thing at first .. You can learn the other thing as a side one. But there is always a main technology you want to learn . Every thing can be done with passion and by the time and experience things will be open and clear for you
Well, I want to learn rails because I want to build a web app, and enough front-end to put a face for it, you know...
Yes go and get your app done
